Hi there, The last thread about CORS is from last year, but I got a question:

The HubSpot doc says that requests need to be done from the same origin, something is weird is happening for me:

• I have a serverless function at <http://test1.mydomain.com|test1.mydomain.com>
• When I do a request to that endpoint from <http://test2.mydomain.com|test2.mydomain.com>, I get the CORS error
• But when I do a request to that endpoint from Postman, it works!
Why does it work from Postman but not from another subdomain? I mean, if it's a CORS thing, it shouldn't work on Postman either, no?
CORS is really only applicable for most frontend applications (HubSpot has pretty strict cors but postman has none)
If the domain is hosted on HubSpot the endpoint will also be accessible from that 2nd domain
Thanks <@U01QVR44MEY>! yes, both subdomains are hosted in HubSpot. Do you know how to allow the 1st subdomain to accept requests from the 2nd subdomain?
Not really, but as long as both of the domains are hosted in HubSpot you can just change the endpoint url to match the page url
